alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 25 at 2:07PM MDT until October 26 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 4 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Locally higher amounts are possible, particularly in the upper Cottonwoods. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 and Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 4 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected, especially for the Cottonwood Canyons and across high elevation seasonal routes such as Monte Cristo and the Mirror Lake Highway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow, heavy at times, will spread across the area beginning late Wednesday night, then become widespread and heavy at times Thursday morning. Snow will taper to showers Thursday afternoon before ending by early Thursday evening. Hikers, hunters, campers and other recreationalists in the backcountry should be prepared for winter conditions with accumulating snow across the northern mountains.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.
